wikibase-error-unexpected:
Generic error messaged used for reporting unknown exception.

Parameters:
* $1 - the raw, unlocalized error message
{{Identical|Error}}
wikibase-error-unknown: Generic error shown when no parameters have been passed alongside an unknown error
wikibase-error-save-generic: Generic error message for an error happening during a save operation.
wikibase-error-remove-generic: Generic error message for an error happening during a remove operation
wikibase-error-save-timeout: Error message for an error happening during a save operation. The error was caused by a request time out.
wikibase-error-remove-timeout: Error message for an error happening during a remove operation. The error was caused by a request time out.
wikibase-error-ui-no-external-page:
This is a human readable version of the API error "wikibase-api-no-external-page" which is shown in the UI.

Parameters:
* $1 - global site ID, known to be valid
* $2 - requested page name that could not be found on the site
{{related|Wikibase-no-external-page}}
wikibase-error-ui-edit-conflict:
This is a human readable version of the API error "edit-conflict" which is shown in the UI.
Note that the default message says the user shall "reload and save", but after a reload the content that should be saved will be lost.
wikibase-language-fallback-transliterati:
Message shown instead of a language name to indicate that a language fallback involved transliteration.
* $1 - the name of the source language
* $2 - the name of the resulting language
wikibase-quantitydetails-amount:
Label used for the "amount" field of a quantity value when showing a detailed representation of the quantity, e.g. in a diff.
{{Identical|Amount}}
wikibase-quantitydetails-upperbound: Label used for the "upper bound" field of a quantity value when showing a detailed representation of the quantity, e.g. in a diff.
wikibase-quantitydetails-lowerbound: Label used for the "lower bound" field of a quantity value when showing a detailed representation of the quantity, e.g. in a diff.
wikibase-quantitydetails-unit:
Label used for the "unit" field of a quantity value when showing a detailed representation of the quantity, e.g. in a diff.
{{Identical|Unit}}
wikibase-timedetails-time:
Label used for the rendered version of a time value when showing a detailed representation of the time, e.g. in a diff.
{{Identical|Time}}
wikibase-timedetails-isotime:
Label used for the "isotime" field of a time value when showing a detailed representation of the time, e.g. in a diff.
{{Identical|Timestamp}}
wikibase-timedetails-timezone:
Label used for the "timezone" field of a time value when showing a detailed representation of the time, e.g. in a diff.
{{Identical|Time zone}}
wikibase-timedetails-calendar:
Label used for the "calendar" field of a time value when showing a detailed representation of the time, e.g. in a diff.
{{Identical|Calendar}}
wikibase-timedetails-precision:
Label used for the "precision" field of a time value when showing a detailed representation of the time, e.g. in a diff.
{{Identical|Precision}}
wikibase-timedetails-before:
Label used for the "before" field of a time value when showing a detailed representation of the time, e.g. in a diff.
{{Identical|Before}}
wikibase-timedetails-after:
Label used for the "after" field of a time value when showing a detailed representation of the time, e.g. in a diff.
{{Identical|After}}
wikibase-globedetails-longitude:
Label used for the "longitude" field of a globecoordinate value when showing a detailed representation of the time, e.g. in a diff.
{{Identical|Longitude}}
wikibase-globedetails-latitude:
Label used for the "latitude" field of a globecoordinate value when showing a detailed representation of the time, e.g. in a diff.
{{Identical|Latitude}}
wikibase-globedetails-precision:
Label used for the "precision" field of a globecoordinate value when showing a detailed representation of the time, e.g. in a diff.
{{Identical|Precision}}
wikibase-globedetails-globe: Label used for the "globe" field of a globecoordinate value when showing a detailed representation of the time, e.g. in a diff.
wikibase-snakview-snaktypeselector-somev:
Short descriptive title of a some-value snak (see [[d:Wikidata:Glossary]]) used in a drop-down menu allowing to select the snak type when adding or editing a snak. The drop-down menu can be opened by clicking an anchor right next to the input element(s) used to specify a claim's value. Although this is regarded a 'special', seldom used feature, the term 'snak' should be avoided here since the concept of snaks is a technical abstraction that does not give any additional meaning within the user interface. The basic meaning of this option is that a value exists but it is unknown.

See also {{msg-mw|Wikibase-snakview-variations-somevalue-label}}
wikibase-snakview-snaktypeselector-noval:
A short descriptive title of a no-value snak (see [[d:Wikidata:Glossary]]) used in a drop-down menu allowing to select the snak type when adding or editing a snak. The drop-down menu can be opened by clicking an anchor right next to the input element(s) used to specify a claim's value. Although this is regarded a 'special', seldom used feature, the term 'snak' should be avoided here since the concept of snaks is a technical abstraction that does not give any additional meaning within the user interface. The basic meaning of this option is that no value exists.

See also {{msg-mw|Wikibase-snakview-variations-novalue-label}}
wikibase-undeserializable-value: Message to display for any data values that are invalid and cannot be deserialized.  The message is displayed in such places as when users view a diff.
datatypes-type-mediawiki-title:
The name of a data type
{{related|Datatypes-type}}
datatypes-type-globe-coordinate:
The name of a data type
{{related|Datatypes-type}}
datatypes-type-time:
The name of a data type.
{{related|Datatypes-type}}
datatypes-type-commonsMedia:
The name of a data type for media files on Wikimedia Commons (proper name, capitalised in English; first letter capitalised anyway in this message and relatives).

{{related|Datatypes-type}}
datatypes-type-geo-shape:
The name of a data type for geo-shapes
{{related|Datatypes-type}}
datatypes-type-external-id:
The name of a data type for external identifiers in Wikibase.
{{related|Datatypes-type}}
datatypes-type-entity-schema:
The name of a data type for entity schemas in Wikibase.
{{related|Datatypes-type}}
version-wikibase:
Name of the Wikibase extension collection, used on [[Special:Version]]
{{Identical|Wikibase}}
wikibase-time-calendar-gregorian:
Label displayed with the formatted dates referring to the Gregorian calendar model.
{{Identical|Gregorian}}
wikibase-time-calendar-julian:
Label displayed with the formatted dates referring to the Julian calendar model.
{{Identical|Julian}}
wikibase-time-with-calendar:
{{optional}}
Format for showing a timestamp together with a calendar model.

Parameters:
* $1 - the formatted timestamp
* $2 - the calendar model (may be {{msg-mw|wikibase-time-calendar-gregorian}}, {{msg-mw|wikibase-time-calendar-julian}}, or an item ID)
wikibase-time-precision-CE:
Used to present a point in time CE (current era) with arbitrary precision, if the year on its own could be mistaken for another date component (has one or two digits). $1 is the point in time.
{{Related|Wikibase-time-precision}}
wikibase-time-precision-Gannum:
Used to present a point in time with the precision of 1 billion of years. $1 is the point in time in billion years, rounded to billion years.
{{Related|Wikibase-time-precision}}
wikibase-time-precision-Mannum:
Used to present a point in time with the precision of 1 million of years. $1 is the point in time in million years, rounded to million years.
{{Related|Wikibase-time-precision}}
wikibase-time-precision-annum:
Used to present a point in time with the precision of 10000 years to 100000 years. $1 is the point in time in years, rounded to 10000 or 100000 years.
{{Related|Wikibase-time-precision}}
wikibase-time-precision-millennium:
Used to present a point in time with the precision of 1000 years. $1 is the millennium, given as year rounded up to the next 1000 and divided by 1000.
{{Related|Wikibase-time-precision}}
wikibase-time-precision-century:
Used to present a point in time with the precision of 100 years. $1 is the century, given as year rounded up the next hundred and divided by 100.
{{Related|Wikibase-time-precision}}
wikibase-time-precision-10annum:
Used to present a point in time with the precision of 10 years. $1 is the point in time in years, rounded down to the nearest ten.
{{Related|Wikibase-time-precision}}
wikibase-time-precision-BCE:
Used to present a point in time BCE (before current era) with arbitrary precision. $1 is the point in time.
{{Related|Wikibase-time-precision}}
wikibase-time-precision-BCE-Gannum:
Used to present a point in time BCE (before current era) with the precision of 1 billion of years. $1 is the point in time in billion years, rounded to billion years.
{{Related|Wikibase-time-precision}}
wikibase-time-precision-BCE-Mannum:
Used to present a point in time BCE (before current era) with the precision of 1 million of years. $1 is the point in time in million years, rounded to million years.
{{Related|Wikibase-time-precision}}
wikibase-time-precision-BCE-annum:
Used to present a point in time BCE (before current era) with the precision of 10000 years to 100000 years. $1 is the point in time in years, rounded to 10000 or 100000 years.
{{Related|Wikibase-time-precision}}
wikibase-time-precision-BCE-millennium:
Used to present a point in time BCE (before current era) with the precision of 1000 years. $1 is the millennium, given as year rounded up to the next 1000 and divided by 1000.
{{Related|Wikibase-time-precision}}
wikibase-time-precision-BCE-century:
Used to present a point in time BCE (before current era) with the precision of 100 years. $1 is the century, given as year rounded up the next hundred and divided by 100.
{{Related|Wikibase-time-precision}}
wikibase-time-precision-BCE-10annum:
Used to present a point in time BCE (before current era) with the precision of 10 years. $1 is the point in time in years, rounded down to the nearest ten.
{{Related|Wikibase-time-precision}}
wikibase-monolingualtext:
{{optional}}
Format for displaying monolingual text (along with a language name).

Parameters:
* $1 - the text
* $2 - the code of the language of the text
* $3 - the name of the language of the text, in the user's language.
wikibase-snakformatter-valuetype-mismatc:
Warning shown when if the data value type used by a Snak's (see [[d:Wikidata:Glossary]]) property's data type is different from the type of the Snak's actual value.

Parameters:
* $1 - data value type of the property-value Snak's value.
* $2 - data value type used by the data type used in the property which is used by the property-value Snak
wikibase-snakformatter-property-not-foun: Warning shown when a Snak's (see [[d:Wikidata:Glossary]]) data type could not be determined based on the Snak's property ID.
wikibase-snakformatter-formatting-except:
Warning shown when a Snak (see [[d:Wikidata:Glossary]]) could not be rendered due to an internal error (a FormattingException).
* $1 - the error message from the FormattingException, in English, possibly including technical details.
wikibase-entity-summary-wbsetitem:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary generated when creating a new item. This is a legacy message. Note that some item-specific messages need to be defined with the generic wikibase-entity-summary prefix for use on client wikis.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbcreate-new:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary generated when creating a new entity. This is for backwards compatibility for edits already made and in the database with this message.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbeditentity:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary generated when creating a new entity. This is a legacy message.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbeditentity-cre:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary generated when creating a new entity.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbeditentity-upd:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary generated when updating only non-term parts on an existing entity.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbeditentity-ove:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary generated when overriding an existing item. This is when a user specifically marks an edit in such a way that the data they provide will override any current data on the item.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbeditentity-upd:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary generated when updating only terms on an existing entity}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}

{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary generated when updating only terms on an existing entity in less than 50 languages}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbsetreference:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary generated when creating a reference or setting the value of an existing one.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbsetreference-a:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary generated when adding a reference.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbsetreference-s:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary generated when editing a reference.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbsetlabel-add:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary generated when creating an entity label, which appears in the ''h1'' heading at top of the item-page. Example of a full edit summary is "Added [en] label:  Egypt".}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbsetlabel-set:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary generated when editing an entity label, which appears in the ''h1'' heading at top of the item-page. Example of a full edit summary is "Updated [en] label:  Egypt".}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbsetlabel-remov:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary generated when removing an entity label. Example edit summary is "Removed [en] label".}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbsetdescription:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary when creating an entity description. Example edit summary is "Added [en] description:  a country in Africa".}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}

{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary when editing an entity description. Example edit summary is "Updated [en] description:  a country in Africa".}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}

{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary when removing an entity description. Example edit summary is "Removed [en] description".}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbsetaliases-set:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary when adding or editing entity aliases. Example for adding aliases on the English entity page for Italy: "Set [en] aliases: Italian Republic, Repubblica italiana".}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbsetaliases-add:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary when adding and removing entity aliases. A user can be in edit mode for aliases and can remove one or more aliases, while adding others in the same edit.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}

{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary when adding one or more aliases.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbsetaliases-rem:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary when a user removes one or more aliases.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbsetaliases-upd:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary when a user updates one or more aliases.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbsetlabeldescri:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary generated when editing an entity label, description and aliases. Example of a full edit summary is "Changed [en] label, description and aliases: Label, Description, Alias 1, Alias 2".}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbsetsitelink-ad:
{{wikibase summary messages|sitelinks|Automatic edit summary (autocomment) when adding a language link. Such a summary could appear in English as "Added link to [itwiki]:  Italia".}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}

{{wikibase summary messages|sitelinks|Automatic edit summary (autocomment) when adding a language link with badges. Such a summary could appear in English as "Added link to [itwiki]:  Italia, Q2, Q3".}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbsetsitelink-re:
{{wikibase summary messages|sitelinks|Automatic edit summary (autocomment) when removing a language link from a Wikidata entity (page). Such a summary could appear in English as "Removed link to [itwiki]".}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbcreateclaim-va:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity-claims|Automatic edit summary when a claim is created and a value is used. The values can be of various types, including but not limited to defined properties. This is a LEGACY value, needed for old log entries!}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbcreateclaim-no:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity-claims|Automatic edit summary when ''no value'' is supplied to the claim. A ''no value'' means that there are no valid value to be set for this claim, or that there are no existing value. This is a LEGACY value, needed for old log entries!}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbcreateclaim-so:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity-claims|Automatic edit summary when there should be a value but it is unknown. This is different from the case where there are no valid or existing value. This is a LEGACY value, needed for old log entries!}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbcreateclaim:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity-claims|Automatic edit summary when a claim is created.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbsetclaimvalue:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity-claims|Automatic edit summary when the main value of one or more claim is changed.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbremoveclaims:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity-claims|Automatic edit summary when one or more claim is removed.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbremoveclaims-u:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity-claims|Automatic edit summary when two or more claims are removed.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-special-create-i:
{{wikibase summary messages|entity|Automatic edit summary when creating an item, and supplying one or more values. This page can take an additional sitelink, but this does not reflect in the autocomment. Note that some item-specific messages need to be defined with the generic wikibase-entity-summary prefix for use on client wikis.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbsetclaim-updat:
Automatic edit summary generated when modifying the qualifiers of a claim using setclaim. Parameters:
* $3 - number of claims changed
* $4 - number of qualifiers changed
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}

Automatic edit summary generated when modifying the references of a claim using setclaim. Parameters:
* $3 - number of claims changed
* $4 - number of references changed
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbmergeitems-fro:
Automatic edit summary when merging items. This summary is for the edit made to the item being merged TO.

Parameters:
* $1 - (Unused)
* $2 - (Unused)
* $3 - the item id of the item being merged from

Note that some item-specific messages need to be defined with the generic wikibase-entity-summary prefix for use on client wikis.
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-entity-summary-wbmergeitems-to:
Automatic edit summary when merging items. This summary is for the edit made to the item being merged FROM.

Parameters:
* $1 - (Unused)
* $2 - (Unused)
* $3 - the item id of the item being merged to

Note that some item-specific messages need to be defined with the generic wikibase-entity-summary prefix for use on client wikis.
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-item-summary-wbcreate-new:
{{wikibase summary messages|item|Automatic edit summary generated when creating a new item. This is for backwards compatibility for edits already made and in the database with this message.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-item-summary}}
wikibase-item-summary-wbeditentity:
{{wikibase summary messages|item|Automatic edit summary generated when creating a new item. This is a legacy message.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-item-summary}}
wikibase-item-summary-wbeditentity-creat:
{{wikibase summary messages|item|Automatic edit summary generated when creating a new item.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-item-summary}}

{{wikibase summary messages|item|Automatic edit summary generated when creating a new item.}}
{{Identical|Wikibase-item-summary-wbeditentity-create}}
wikibase-item-summary-wbeditentity-updat:
{{wikibase summary messages|item|Automatic edit summary generated when updating only non-term parts on an existing item.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-item-summary}}
wikibase-item-summary-wbeditentity-overr:
{{wikibase summary messages|item|Automatic edit summary generated when overriding an existing item. This is when a user specifically marks an edit in such a way that the data they provide will override any current data on the item.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-item-summary}}
wikibase-property-summary-wbcreate-new:
{{wikibase summary messages|item|Automatic edit summary generated when creating a new item. This is for backwards compatibility for edits already made and in the database with this message.}}
{{Related|Wikibase-property-summary}}
wikibase-property-summary-wbeditentity-c:
Automatic edit summary generated when creating a new property.
{{Related|Wikibase-property-summary}}

Automatic edit summary generated when creating a new property.
{{Identical|Wikibase-property-summary-wbeditentity-create}}
wikibase-property-summary-wbeditentity-u: Autocomment message for client (e.g. Wikipedia) recent changes when a linked Wikidata item non-term parts get changed.
wikibase-property-summary-wbeditentity-o:
Automatic edit summary generated when overriding an existing property.
{{Related|Wikibase-property-summary}}
wikibase-property-summary-special-create:
Automatic edit summary when creating a property, and supplying one or more values. Parameters:
* $1 - the number of values set (that is 0 - zero)
* $2 - the language code of the entity page during creation
{{Related|Wikibase-property-summary}}
wikibase-reference-formatter-snak-separa:
{{optional|Only translate it in languages where the default is not suitable; for instance, CJK languages may need U+FF0E FULLWIDTH FULL STOP (&#xFF0E; → ．) instead of the default full stop and space. Other languages must use another punctuation or word (or sometimes nothing), with just spacing.}}

Separates two pieces of information in a reference formatted for Wikitext.
wikibase-reference-formatter-snak-termin:
{{optional|Only translate it in languages where the default is not suitable; for instance, CJK languages may need U+FF0E FULLWIDTH FULL STOP (&#xFF0E; → ．) instead of the default full stop.}}

Terminates (finishes) a reference formatted for Wikitext. Similar to {{msg-mw|wikibase-reference-formatter-snak-separator}}, but without extra whitespace.
wikibase-reference-formatter-snak-retrie:
Format for the “retrieved” part of a reference formatted for Wikitext.

Parameters:
* $1 - the retrieved date, formatted.

This will be separated from other parts of the reference with {{msg-mw|wikibase-reference-formatter-snak-separator}} and closed off with {{msg-mw|wikibase-reference-formatter-snak-terminator}}, so there is no need to include a full stop at the end.
wikibase-SortedProperties:
{{notranslate}}
Used to defines the sorting of the properties. Example: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/MediaWiki:Wikibase-SortedProperties
